title: Russia COVID-19 vaccination rate 2023 | Statista
author: Statista Research Department; Jun
description: What percentage of Russia is vaccinated for COVID-19? With over 55 percent fully vaccinated, Russia's COVID-19 vaccination rate was one of Europe's lowest.
cleaned_text: COVID-19 vaccination rate in Russia 2020-2023 [Russia's COVID-19 vaccination rate reached around 129 administered doses per 100 population as of May 26, 2023. The rate of fully vaccinated residents was nearly 55.1 per 100 people. Russia's](#statisticContainer) [COVID-19 vaccination rate was among the lowest in Europe](/statistics/1196071/covid-19-vaccination-rate-in-europe-by-country/). COVID-19 vaccination in RussiaThe mass vaccination against COVID-19 in Russia started at the beginning of 2021. As of May 2023, over 88 million [Russians got at least one vaccine dose](/statistics/1239321/covid-19-vaccinated-population-in-russia/). Several regions, including the capital Moscow, required companies in specific industries to vaccinate at least 60 percent of their staff. Such sectors included healthcare, education, retail, and various services, among others. The restrictions were largely lifted in the spring and summer of 2022. Attitude toward COVID-19 vaccination in RussiaWhen asked if they [planned to get vaccinated against COVID-19](/statistics/1114599/opinion-on-vaccination-against-covid-19-in-russia/), over one-quarter of Russians stated they would definitely or most probably do it, according to a survey from June 2021. Furthermore, nearly one-fifth of respondents reported being vaccinated already at that point. The most common [motives to get vaccinated](/statistics/1222096/reasons-to-get-vaccinated-against-covid-in-russia/)for Russians were to be able to travel without restrictions and not to worry about their health. The main [reason behind vaccination hesitancy](/statistics/1247572/Reasons-against-COVID-19-vaccination-Russia/)was a concern about the long-term consequences of COVID-19 vaccines.
